p: New HIV infections are concentrated among key populations at higher risk, more difficult to reach due to stigma and legal barriers. These key populations include people who inject drugs (PWID), female sex workers (FSW), men who have sex with men (MSM) and transgender (TG) women. In low- and middle-income countries, the burden of HIV infection was disproportionately high among FSW in Asia and the Pacific, with a 29-fold increase in odds of living with HIV compared with women of reproductive age 3.
